H0.text: what is the holy book of the buddhist religion. Tripitaka

H1.text: what is the holy book of the buddhist religion. Dhammapada

H2.text: what is the holy book of the buddhist religion. Mahayana Sutras

H3.text: what is the holy book of the buddhist religion. Āgama

A4.text: The Pāli Tipiṭaka is composed of the Vinaya Piṭaka, the Sutta Piṭaka, and the Abhidhamma Piṭaka.

A5.text: A complete version of the Dīrgha Āgama of the Dharmaguptaka school was translated into Chinese by Buddhayaśas and Zhu Fonian in the Later Qin dynasty, dated to 413 CE.

A6.text: Numerous Mahayana sutras teach the veneration and recitation of the sutras themselves as a religious icon and as an embodiment of the Dharma and the Buddha.

A7.text: The Dhammapada is a collection of sayings of the Buddha in verse form and one of the most widely read and best known Buddhist scriptures.

A8.text: The original version of the Dhammapada is in the Khuddaka Nikaya, a division of the Pali Canon of Theravada Buddhism.
